noun.description: A shrill, wailing sound, especially that of bagpipes.
examples: we heard a skirl of the pipes

verb.description: (of bagpipes) make a shrill, wailing sound.
examples: the pipes skirled and moaned down the street
the skirling of the Breton bagpipes

origin: Late Middle English (as a verb): probably of Scandinavian origin; ultimately imitative.
